page.title: 13BIRDS IN EAST WITTERING
page.content: Resident birds in this area are numerous.Apart from the more common birds they include the kestrel,wren, barn owl,tawny owl,chaffinch,hedge sparrow,green finch,pheasant and green woodpecker. In Winter Brent geese visit the area.They breed in the Artic and winter here.They are a problem to farmers as they eat the Winter planted wheat and cannot be shot because they are a protected species. Oyster catchers feed on the school field during the Winter,their long beaks probing into the ground to find juicy morsels. Blackheaded Gulls and Lapwings flock together for all to see,and in bad weather Field Fares and Redwings feed also.
